Indicator estimation

Miquel De Cáceres / Núria Aquilué

2025-10-15

Source: vignettes/IndicatorEstimation.Rmd
IndicatorEstimation.Rmd

Introduction

Note the various macros within the vignette section of the metadata block above. These are required in order to instruct R how to build the vignette. Note that you should change the title field and the \VignetteIndexEntry to match the title of your vignette.

Indicator functions and parameters

The figure sizes have been customised so that you can easily put two images side-by-side.

indicators <- c("timber_harvest", "density_dead_wood")
additional_parameters[additional_parameters$indicator %in% indicators, ]
#>           indicator        parameter default_value
#> 1    timber_harvest         province          <NA>
#> 2    timber_harvest     min_tree_dbh          <NA>
#> 3    timber_harvest     max_tree_dbh          <NA>
#> 4    timber_harvest targeted_species          <NA>
#> 5    timber_harvest excluded_species          <NA>
#> 8 density_dead_wood     min_tree_dbh          17.5
#> 9 density_dead_wood     max_tree_dbh          <NA>
#>                                                                            description
#> 1                                                      Spanish province (numeric code)
#> 2            Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of harvest volume
#> 3 Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of harvest volume
#> 4                         Tree species included in the calculation of harvested volume
#> 5                     Tree species not included in the calculation of harvested volume
#> 8      Minimum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood
#> 9      Maximum  tree diameter to be included in the estimation of density of dead wood

Indicator estimation

Define values for additional parameters 

params <- list(timber_harvest = list(province = 8),
               density_dead_wood = list(max_tree_dbh = 20))

Estimation function 

res <- estimate_indicators(indicators,
                           plant_dynamic_input = example_plant_dynamic_input,
                           timber_volume_function = forestindicators:::.ifn_volume_forestindicators,
                           additional_params = params,
                           verbose = TRUE)
#> ℹ Checking overall inputs
#> ✔ Checking overall inputs [15ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Checking inputs for 'timber_harvest'.
#> ✔ Checking inputs for 'timber_harvest'. [16ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Processing 'timber_harvest'.
#> ✔ Processing 'timber_harvest'. [122ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Checking inputs for 'density_dead_wood'.
#> ✔ Checking inputs for 'density_dead_wood'. [15ms]
#> 
#> ℹ Processing 'density_dead_wood'.
#> ✔ Processing 'density_dead_wood'. [19ms]
#>
id_stand date timber_harvest density_dead_wood
